data.title: Howard William Adams, Jr.
data.meta_site_name: The Daily Gazette Family of Newspapers
data.text:
Schodack- Howard William Adams, Jr., son of the late Marjorie (Fulton) Adams and Howard William Adams, Sr., entered God’s Kingdom peacefully on August 15, 2015 after an untimely illness.

Howard was born on October 8, 1937 in Albany, NY and grew up in the city of Rensselaer. He graduated from Van Rensselaer High School in 1956. Howard retired from BASF Corp. after 40 plus years with the title of Supervisor.

Howard is survived by his beloved wife Linda Diane (Williams) Adams, children Melissa A. Hilstro and her beloved husband William J. Hilstro, Sr., Scott Adams, Christine Marie Genito, James D. Genito and his beloved wife Amy Genito, grandchildren William J. Hilstro, Jr., Sarah M. Hilstro, Cristyn Barron and her beloved husband Eric, Brittany Lynn Herson, Sage Kristian Herson, Rachel Jane Genito and Emma Rose Genito. Howard is survived by three siblings, Frank A. Adams, Bruce E. Adams and Darryl L. Adams. Howard is survived by many nieces and nephews.

Howard served in the United States Army stationed in Fort Sam Houston, Texas. Howard held the rank of Medical Specialist/Sergeant and awarded the Sharpshooter Badge (Rifle). Howard received an honorable discharge from active duty in 1963, and returned to the Army Reserve, completing his service obligation of six years. Howard was a long time member of the Melvin Roads American Legion Post #1231, past member of Pumper #4 Rensselaer Fire Department and Troy Lodge of Elks BPOE # 141. Howard was an avid sportsman and loved to bow-hunt in Canada, Texas, Colorado, Mexico and Illinois. Being a serious trophy and bow hunter, Howard respectfully worked with locals and adhered to rules of conservation. He made many friends out west, later finding an article of himself in a deer hunter’s magazine. As a sportsman, he also enjoyed fishing with his wife Linda and his buddy Ed Despart on Lake Ontario.

A special thank you goes out to the Greenbush Reformed Church, Donald Jukes friend and member in the Methodist Church, friends in the Emmanuel Reformed Church, friend Ed Despart and family, friends at Flying Arrows and precious friends who graciously sent cards and prayers during Howard’s struggle for life.

Relatives and friends are invited and may call at the W. J. Lyons Funeral Home, Inc., 1700 Washington Avenue, Rensselaer Wednesday August 19, 2015 from 4-7 PM. The funeral will be at the funeral home, Thursday, August 20, 2015 at 10:30 AM, all are welcome to attend.

Donations in memory of Howard W. Adams, Jr. may be made to the Greenbush Reformed Church, PO Box 460, 688 Columbia Tpke., East Greenbush, NY 12061. Condolence page at www.wjlyonsfuneralhome.com.

Laura C. Deyo

On the morning of Friday, August 14, 2015, Laura C. Deyo, 95, of Earlton, was escorted by her angels to her final resting place in heaven. She passed away at her home surrounded by her loving family.

Laura was born in Coxsackie to John and Catherine (Cross) Vandermark on October 1, 1919. She enjoyed sitting on her porch swing watching her birds, doing puzzle books, gardening, baking and traveling. Most of all, Laura enjoyed her family. She was the “bestest” Mom and devoted “Gram.”

Laura was predeceased by her husband, Willard Sr., and her son, Willard Jr. Also predeceasing her were her brothers and sisters, George, Robbie, Skip, Ray, Stanley, Goldie, Beattie, Lillian, Dorothy, Margaret, Madeline, and Katy.

Laura is survived by her sons, Frank(Gail), Tom (Doris), Dave (Peggy), Tim (Lorraine), Mark (Linda), her daughters, Sue Smith (Bill), Laurie Deyo and Nancy Adrian (Mike). She is also survived by her sister, Evelyn Cotich, 13 grandchildren and several great and great-great grandchildren, as well as many nieces and nephews. Her two devoted granddaughters, Megan Adrian and Sandra Dauski assisted in care giving for their “Gram;” who held a special place in her heart for “her girls.”

Calling hours will be held at Richards Funeral Home, 29 Bross Street, Cairo, on Tuesday, August 18, 2015 from 2-4 and 6-8 PM. Funeral services will be held on Wednesday, August 19, 2015 at 11:00 A.M. at the funeral home, with Pastor Retta Lykens officiating. Interment will follow in the family plot of The Greenville Cemetery.

Contributions in her memory may be made to Community Hospice, 47 Liberty Street, Catskill, NY, 12414, or to The Cairo United Methodist Church, P.O. Box # 552, Cairo, NY, 12413.

Condolences may be made at www.richardsfuneralhomeinc.net.

Conchetta Ann Formichelli

Conchetta Ann Formichelli 95, of Hudson, died Sunday August 16, 2015 at The Firemen's Home in Hudson. Born in Alife, Italy on April 18, 1920 she was the daughter of the late Guisippe and Nicolena (Angelilo) Firenze. Ann was the widow of the late Nicholas L. Formichelli. She was a waitress for 30 years at the St. Charles Hotel in Hudson. Ann was a member of the former Our Lady of Mt. Carmel Church in Hudson, past President of the Ladies Sodality of Mt. Carmel, Columbia County Sons and Daughters of Italy, and was a volunteer at Columbia Memorial Hospital for 14 years. She is survived by her sons Michael and (Jane) Formichelli of Hudson, Joseph and (Kelly) Formichelli of Laguna Niquell, CA, Nicholas Formichelli of Highland, NY and Anthony and (Janet) Formichelli of Poughkeepsie, NY. also one sister Carmella Yerdon of Cornwall, NY 7 grandchildren and 7 great-grandchildren. In addition to her husband, she was pre-deceased by brothers:Michael and Loretto Firenze, sisters: Antoinette Maturo and Marion Russo and her grandson Michael Formichelli, Jr.

Calling hours will be Thursday August 20, from (4-7) pm at the Sacco-McDonald-Valenti Funeral Home 700 Town Hall Drive Hudson.Panakhyda prayers at the funeral home at 6:30pm. A Mass of Christian Burial will be Friday August 21, 10:00am at St.Nicholas Ukrainian Catholic Church in Hudson with Fr. John Jedrychowski officiating. Burial will follow in Cedar Park Cemetery.

Henry “Pat” R. Hoysradt

Ancram- Henry “Pat” R. Hoysradt, 97, of Ancram, NY, passed away peacefully at the Sharon Healthcare Center in CT this past Thursday, August 13 surrounded by his loving family.

Born on May 7, 1918, he was the son of Henry J. and Leila (Niver) Hoysradt.

Pat, a Pine Plains graduate, attended the Berkshire School in Sheffield, MA, as well as Williams College in Williamstown, MA. He later owned and operated a dairy farm.

In 1940 he married the love of his life, Helen Jessup, in Ancramdale, NY. Mrs. Hoysradt survives him at the Sharon Health Center. His final years were spent loving and caring for his wife.

A true Yankee to the core, Pat played four years of professional baseball with the Yankee Organization from 1938-1941. A standout athlete with a promising baseball career ahead of him, as a young man Pat moved on to establish his farm and build a family with his wife, Helen, that has grown to over 25 grandchildren and great-grandchildren today. His love of baseball continued as a dedicated fan of the New York Yankees; Pat could discuss the strengths and weaknesses of their roster in great detail from the days of Maris and Mantle to the final weeks of his life.

Pat was very active in the community. He was a member of St. John’s Lutheran Church as well as a former council member, a life time member of the Ancram Fire Co, and a member of Cornell Cooperative Extension of Columbia County. Pat was also in the Dutchess County Hall of Fame for both baseball and basketball.

A man of immense faith, quiet strength and unwavering dedication to family, Pat has been a pillar of the community for nearly a century. Despite his modest nature, his character inspired deep respect and admiration from all who knew him. Pat’s legacy lives on through his family who will still feel the powerful strength of his character long after his passing.

In addition to his loving wife, Pat is survived by his children, daughters Judith Hatch of Stamford and Susan Hamburger of Clinton Corners; sons, Russell of Newfoundland, Canada, David of Ancram, and Daniel of Copake Lake; as well as 13 grandchildren and 12 great grandchildren.

He was preceded by sisters Carrie Kennedy and Gladys Doty; sons Henry and Patrick; and granddaughter Amee VanTassell.

Visitation will be held at the Peck and Peck Funeral Home, 7749 S. Main St., Pine Plains, on Tuesday, August 18, from 2 to 4 and 6 to 8 PM.

A Memorial Service will be held on Wednesday, August 19 at 11AM at St. John’s Lutheran Church in Ancram, NY with Deacon Jackie Jefferson officiating. Burial will be private and at the convenience of the family at Evergreen Cemetery. A reception will follow the service on Wednesday at the Ancram Fire House.

In lieu of flowers, memorial donations in honor of Pat can be made to St. John’s Lutheran Church, Ancram, NY 12502.

To send and online condolence, please visit peckandpeck.net.

Roy J. Hoyt

Roy J. Hoyt, 85, of Claverack, died August 15, 2015 at Whittier Nursing Home. www.batesanderson.com

Ezra J. Link

Ezra J. Link, 82 of Copake, NY passed away on Monday August 10, 2015 at his residence.

He was born on August 18, 1932 in Copake to Ezra J. and Marion (Smith) Link.

A self employed mechanic, he previously had worked at both the Preusser and Dykeman Garages.

A pitmaster, Mr. Link prepared BBQ dinners for over 30 years for the Pine Plains Lions Club and several local fire companies. An avid hunter, he was a member of the Oxbow Club in Hillsdale, life member of the Craryville Fire Company and was a longtime horse owner and trainer in the harness racing industry.

On April 7, 1962 in West Copake he married Patti (Konig) Link who survives him at home.

Besides his wife he leaves a son and daughter in law, Ezra and Kristine Link of Copake and three grandchildren, Aleshia, Michelle and Kathleen Link. He also leaves his niece Drinda Post and other nieces and nephews.

A Celebration of Life will be held on Sunday, August 23nd at the Link Residence. From 2:00 - 5:00pm

3116 County Route 7 Copake, NY 12529

Private interment will be at the convenience of the family.

In lieu of flowers kindly consider the Community Rescue Squad, PO Box 327, Copake NY 12516.

To send and online condolence please visit www.peckandpeck.net.

Helen (Chaikowski) Moore

Helen (Chaikowski) Moore 89 of Elizaville, died August 12, 2015 at Columbia Memorial Hospital. Mrs. Moore was born; October 15, 1925 in Hudson, the daughter of the late John and Nellie (Krylow) Chaikowski.

She was a graduate of Hudson High School and through the Hudson American Legion attended Girls State in her Junior year. Had been employed by Canada Dry Ginger Ale, Eden Park Nursing Home and retiring from the Germantown Central School as where she worked as a librarian.

She was a member of the Linlithgo Reformed Church of Livingston where she taught Sunday School and was a member of the Reformed Church Women’s Ministry in which she held many offices. She served 25 years plus in the Edith Casey Stocking Fund Program and the Pro Check Program, she had been a den mother for Cub Scouts, volunteered at the Livingston History Barn, was a Charter Member of the Livingston Pumper Co. No. 1 Auxiliary, volunteered at “Mary’s Helpers” maker of rosary beads for Armed Forces and Missionaries. She was a member, past President and Secretary of the Taghkanic Senior Citizens and she enjoyed the matinees at the Mac Hayden Theater.

She is survived by her two sons: Robert Q. Moore (Karen) of Livingston and L. Edward Moore (wife Diane Banks Moore) of Clermont, one sister Janette Hirsch of San Diego, Calif. grandchildren: John Edward Moore, Michael William Moore and Brian Robert Moore, a sister-in-law Eleanor (Disen) Chaikowski, and several nieces and nephews.

She was predeceased by her husband Quentin R. Moore who died April 18, 2012, son, Thomas Walter Moore, sisters; Anna Smith, Mary G. Zimm, brothers Walter E. Chaikowski and Stephan F. Chaikowski.

Services were private and burial was in the family lot at Cedar Park Cemetery of Hudson.

Memorial Donations are requested to the Linlithgo Reformed Church of Livingston, P.O. Box 477 Livingston, NY 12541

Condolences may be expressed at yadackfox.com

E. Juanita Salvatore

E. Juanita Salvatore 85, of Greenport, NY died Sunday August 16, 2015 at Pine Haven Nursing Home in Philmont. Born in Sarasota, FL on May 10, 1930, she was the daughter of the late Leland and Laura Hardison. Juanita was a Waitress at Kozels Restaurant for over 25 years and was a member of the Faith and Love Fellowship Church in Rensselaer. She was the loving wife of Pasquale "Pat" Salvatore of Greenport. She is also survived by sons: James Rieffannacht and (April), John Bogardus and (Lisa) of Stockport, daughters: Sharon Abbott of TX, Linda Rieffannacht and (Bill) of TX, Maureen Salas of Nassau, Theresa Barrows of LA, Dee Rieffanacht and (Dave) of FL, Penny Burdett and (Rick) of Nassau, Dwan Rieffannacht of Rennselaer, Numerous grandchildren, great and great-great grandchildren. She was pre-deceased by her daughter Robyn VanAllen.

Calling hours will be Friday August 21, from 11am-1pm at the Sacco-McDonald-Valenti Funeral Home 700 Town Hall Drive Hudson, NY. Services will follow at the funeral home at 1pm with Pastor Janet VanDenhouten officiating. Burial will follow in the Linlithgo Cemetery.

Vasta, Vincent James (Jimmy)

Vasta, Vincent James (Jimmy), 101, passed peacefully into the arms of our Lord on Thursday, August 6, 2015.

Born in New York City, January 29, 1914, son of the late Giuseppe and Maria Vasta.

Vinnie worked for Republic Aviation on LI, NY, and was part of the Apollo 13 Lunar Excursion Module (L.E.M) Mission Team for Grumman’s Aviation. After retiring from a rewarding career, he moved to up-state New York.

He was predeceased by his wives Gertrude Brooks and Gloria Lutes, and his daughter Faith Grandstaff. Survivors include his children: Steven Vasta, Coxsackie, NY; Joe Vasta (Albie), Glenmont, NY; and Chickie Pearson, Orlando, FL,; 6 Grandchildren and 7 Great-Grandchildren.

When Vinnie married Gloria Lutes he gained another wonderful family who treated and loved him as their own Dad & Grandfather. He was known as “Poppa Vinnie” to all. Survivors include: Charlene Hull (John), Oak Hill, NY; Christine Labuda, Indian Trail, NC; John Lutes, (Celine) Cairo, NY; and Billy Lutes (Cathy), of Catskill, NY, several Grandchildren and Great-Grandchildren.

Dad will always be remembered for his beautiful cars and his love for Big Band music, especially Louie Prima & Louie Armstrong. He was the life of every party and loved to dance and entertain.

The Family would like to sincerely thank the staff at Begg’s Point Assisted Living for the loving care they bestowed on our Father in his final years. It will never be forgotten.

A celebration of his life will be held at a later date.

Charles H. Westover
